job_title: Head of Builder Web Experience, AWS Developer Marketing
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Do you wake up in the morning excited about what cloud computing can do for customers of all shapes and sizes? Are you a passionate product manager who wants to help educate technical builders around the world? The AWS Developer Marketing Team is seeking a driven, talented, and experienced product manager to transform the way hands-on technical builder learn, experiment, and seek guidance on how to leverage AWS services.

You will have the opportunity to lead a team and define the strategy for how we help Developers, IT Professionals, systems engineers, cloud architects, and infrastructure engineers get started and learn how to leverage AWS. You will be responsible for defining the strategy and user experience for our builder focused web properties aimed at streamlining education and building community.

Ideally, you are someone that has experience building programs that foster deep, meaningful adoption of technology. You have an innate understanding of technical builders needs and how they make decisions to use technology. You are knowledgeable about current state-of-the-art cloud technologies and understand how they are driving change for ways that developers conceive, build, and operate systems. If you are passionate about helping developers innovate and create tomorrow’s amazing software, then this is the perfect role for you.

Key job responsibilities

Create a content strategy that ensures highly credible and effective messaging for AWS services that are used by builders from all backgrounds including developers, IT professionals, systems architects, DevOps engineers.
Create a compelling user experience that help educate builders on AWS
Drive technical content development across teams (developer relations, product marketing, and solutions architecture) through business requirements, design, implementation, and deployment
Engage with external engineers, technology advocates, and open source communities to gain insight on current and future development trends


Basic Qualifications

10+ years of relevant work experience in marketing, marketing communications, community marketing, and/or digital/high-technology companies/products
5+ years leading a worldwide customer-facing product/program
5+ years of experience of operating and collaborating in a fast-paced, cross-functional, matrixed global organization
5+ years managing and leading a high-velocity product team

Preferred Qualifications

A Bachelor degree in marketing, business, technology, or relevant field of study.
Proven track record in building engaging web experiences.
A career path that demonstrates increasing levels of responsibility.
Accomplished range of skills from high level strategic thinking to creative and detailed execution.
Proven success in managing complex and multi-faceted marketing programs with the ability to drive projects through completion.
The candidate must also be a strong leader and excellent communicator who can drive consensus and articulate program recommendations and tradeoffs to senior leadership.
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc.

Job ID: A1957365

Posted by

Candice Schmitt 2nd

Mom | Operations Exec @ Groundswell | People-Positive Realist

Send InMail

We’re looking for a Senior React Native Developer to lead the build of our iOS and Android app. As an early member of the team, this person will be responsible for end-to-end mobile application development and excited to take ownership (building, shipping and maintaining) of an application that is sure to change the landscape of individual and corporate giving. This role will work closely with the rest of the engineering team, product and design to spec-out, design and implement solutions for our end-users from version 1 and onward.




This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to join a founding team aiming to create a solution to disrupt philanthropy and create world-wide impact. Tired of working at companies that are adding to society’s ills instead of solving them? Come contribute to our vision, a future where every solution is funded, and every problem is solved.




Groundswell is a new type of financial service that uses powerful technology for better giving. Our product allows companies to create personal foundations for its employees and match employee contributions straight from payroll, like a 401K for giving. Groundswell then provides users with access to all of the tools available to ultra-rich philanthropists: tax-free investments to grow your impact, matching to the best non-profits for the causes you care about, frictionless donations, a unified picture of your impact over time, and a single tax receipt at the end of the year. It puts employees in the driver's seat of corporate philanthropy and empowers them to create world-wide impact.




Our founding team has founded, sold, and IPO’d multiple companies totaling billions of dollars in enterprise value. We have deep experience building and selling products to both consumers and enterprises. Comment start The company has raised $15 million in seed funding, led by GV (Google Ventures) and capable of offering competitive pay, benefits, and equity packages.

We are firmly rooted in the belief that challenging problems are best solved in real time by highly cohesive teams.




We are excited to be back to work in office and building an incredible culture of connection and collaboration. The safety of our employees and their families is our top priority and we do require that all Groundswell employees working in the office are fully vaccinated.

Interested in leveraging your technical expertise and passion for progress for world good? Join us!




Responsibilities

Spend most of your time working in React Native to build user-facing features with top notch UI and UX.
Take full ownership and responsibility for building, shipping, and maintaining features.
Diagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks for performance that feels native.
Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
Perform code reviews for other engineers
Proactively identify areas for improvement and make recommendations for solutions within the code base.
Work closely with product and engineering teams to spec-out, design and implement user-facing features.
Understand and collaborate on complete product lifecycle from concept to execution.
Stay up to date with tech stack and industry trends, sharing knowledge and best practices with the team.




Skills and Requirements

5+ years recent experience building mobile apps with React Native
7+ years experience building consumer-facing client apps
Bachelor’s degree or higher - Computer Science or equivalent field
Previous experience in early stage product design
Previous experience deploying both Android and iOS mobile apps
Partner with business and technology team members, to understand requirements and translate them into value-add technology solutions
Willingness to learn and expand skills and repertoire
A positive mindset, team-oriented, results-driven, and organized.




What We Value

We foster a high-trust culture. On our team things like integrity, trust, and respect are table stakes.
We embrace diversity. We value diversity not for its own sake but because we staunchly believe different experiences and perspectives will make us better. Oh, and we think diverse workplaces are simply more fun and interesting.
We value high competence, but low ego. Your pedigree isn’t what will earn you respect around here; your competence and humility will. It doesn’t matter to us whether you’re coming from the School of Hard Knocks or an Ivy League.
We believe we can change the world. If you don’t have an unabashed belief that you can make the world a better place, then you should go work at Amazon and help ship cat food faster.
We work smarter and harder. Our mission is too important and vision too bold to simply show up and mail it in. You must have an all-hands-on-deck attitude and sports team mentality.
We celebrate. We have fun. We want teammates that we are eager to see on Monday morning because they make our lives richer.
We never stop learning. We seek and give feedback, not for agreement or consensus, but to get to the best idea. Groupthink leads to Groupsink.

Exciting opportunity for a "Front-end Developer"




Our client is a global leader in cloud-deployed automation and simplifying the investment process across asset classes, Portfolio Management, and risk analyst. Enabling our clients to access data, analytics, application, and liquidity providers that support their product and asset class mix.




Responsibilities include:

Senior Front-end Developer- Hybrid schedules with a well-known and respected facility. This is a full-time role.

Great opportunity to work with other talented developers in a very stable facility building new products in the fintech space!




Excellent salary, bonus, and benefits!




Hybrid 3 days onsite 2 days remote




Experience

Team Lead or Manager
C# experience will also be helpful
3+ years of developing javascript/typescript Web applications using Node.js
Experience with: React/Redux, Angular.JS HTML/CSS, designing and implementing REST APIs, SQL database schema, and query logic development, AWS EC2, S3, lambda, Cognito, Python programming/or related language for prototyping
Comfortable utilizing, and adapting, code developed by others
Problem solver
Understanding of UX features




Qualified and interested candidates please send your resume, and contact information to Laurie O'Malley at lomalley@spyglasspartners.com

job_title: Front End Engineer - Amazon Forecast (AWS AI)
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Imagine never needing to hop from store to store during holidays because your first stop can anticipate the demand for the products they carry and stock up accordingly.

Imagine never having to wait too long or pay too much because your favorite ride-hailing service can account for weather or local events and direct enough drivers to your area.

Amazon Forecast is a fully managed AWS AI service that uses machine learning to help companies achieve these goals by delivering highly accurate forecasts.

Our engineers and scientists continuously innovate so that our customers can keep up with the speed and scale of their business operations without the data science background or machine learning experience needed for generating highly accurate forecasts.

As a front-end engineer on the Amazon Forecast team, you will:

work closely with UX designers, product managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions.
build greenfield user experiences by incorporating diverse user requirements (e.g., accessibility, internationalization), user hardware constraints, and front-end security risks.
improve and enhance the user experience for the customers of AWS AI services using latest front-end technologies.

You will use modern web-development tools and techniques including TypeScript, Node, React, Redux, CI/CD pipelines, Grunt, Webpack/Babel, Mocha/Jasmine/Jest, HTTP/2, and Git.

Key job responsibilities

Work closely with UX designers, product managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions.
Build greenfield user experiences by incorporating diverse user requirements (e.g., accessibility, internationalization), user hardware constraints, and front-end security risks.
Improve and enhance the user experience for the customers of AWS AI services using latest front-end technologies.

A day in the life

You will use modern web-development tools and techniques including TypeScript, Node, React, Redux, CI/CD pipelines, Grunt, Webpack/Babel, Mocha/Jasmine/Jest, HTTP/2, and Git.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

About The Team

Amazon Forecast is a fully managed AWS AI service that uses machine learning to help companies achieve these goals by delivering highly accurate forecasts.

Our engineers and scientists continuously innovate so that our customers can keep up with the speed and scale of their business operations without the data science background or machine learning experience needed for generating highly accurate forecasts.


Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.
2+ years of professional front-end development
Experience with modern programming languages (JavaScript, C#, or Python) and open-source technologies.
Skilled with common front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JS, TypeScript, Node, React

Preferred Qualifications

Experience building tools for data scientists or developers.
Attuned design sense so can collaborate with UX designers and hold a high bar with “backend” SDE's.
Experience with with CI/CD in a frontend context.
Experience establishing and leveraging web analytics.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.
Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.
hands-on technical expertise in full-stack development.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A1975216

Posted by

William Wilson

Senior Partner

MUST BE US CITIZEN OR GREEN CARD HOLDER

NO SPONSORSHIP

﻿

Fantastic 100% remote role.

Job description

Summary: Provide a wide range of development for new and existing web-based applications, including UI design, coding in highly collaborative, integrated development team environment. In addition, provides a wide range of development support activities for new and existing web-based applications.

Apex Systems is currently looking for multiple Web Developers to join a well-established client in the Denver area!




Job Title: Web Developer

Location: Denver, CO

Estimated Duration: Through 2022 with high likelihood to extend or convert

Compensation: Competitive, Dependent upon experience




Key responsibilities

Develop web applications to visualize and provide insights into large volumes of location-enabled event data.
Offer creative solutions when faced with data volume, data quality, and data usability challenges
Participate in software development lifecycle from requirements gathering to planning long-term support. Be willing to collaborate with non-technical stakeholders, development operations staff, data scientists, and software architects.
Apply professional software engineering techniques and best practices for code standards, software testing, code reviews, source code management, and deployment processes.




Required qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree
3+ years of professional experience with web application development
Proficiency with web application development using JavaScript/HTML/CSS

React
Material-UI
Experience working with Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and a basic understanding of geospatial concepts like spatial reference systems and spatial data representations

Posted by

Patti Franco 2nd

Talent Acquisition Specialist

Send InMail

Frontend Developer (Remote)




Select Blind's vision is to empower people to create spaces they can be proud of. We want to provide an exceptional customer experience that builds confidence with the most diverse selection of window coverings and helpful resources through the entire customer lifecycle. We are growing quickly and are looking for passionate people who want to join a team where they feel valued and where they can actively contribute to growing and building something meaningful. Our company DNA is founded in empowerment and compassion but also fun. We like to laugh. It’s just who we are.




Position Description

As Select Blinds continues on a growth trajectory, we are expanding our team and on the hunt for an experienced Frontend Web Developer. This is a collaborative, team-oriented role where everyone has a voice and creativity is encouraged.




Position Responsibilities

Translate designs to clean, efficient code without loss of functionality or appearance
Implement updates to websites and emails, using HTML, CSS and JavaScript
Provide technical assistance to engineers, designers, and managers as required
Work closely with our User Experience Designers on various projects, and communicate technical issues and suggestions




Ideal Skills

Able to create standards-compliant HTML/CSS files from design comps and style guides
Ability to write custom CSS
Ability to look at a mockup/wireframe and make it come to life
Be able to build beautiful, responsive web pages
Able to integrate standards-compliant HTML/CSS files into existing codebases
Able to write clean, coherent code and follow establish coding style guidelines
Able to optimize the use of images and page speed in general
Sound understanding of programming logic and constructs
Able to prepare web assets according to best practices
Ability to work quickly and efficiently




Ideal Experience

Minimum of four (4) years’ experience with Frontend Development using JavaScript; jQuery; CSS, and HTML with current or past experience writing custom CSS
Experience with source control (i.e., TFVC, Git)
Experience with Web Analytics programs (i.e., Google Analytics)
Experience with executing and analyzing the results of usability testing
Experience with cross-browser, cross-platform, and cross-device testing
Industry experience with home improvement or retail is strongly preferred
Experience with SEO (preferred)
Experience with .NET projects, Visual Studio




About Us

SelectBlinds.com is a leader in DIY custom blinds, where our goal is to provide a friendly, relaxed online environment as an alternative to the aggressive showroom buying environments our competitors create. Our customers are homeowners who want high-quality, budget friendly DIY window coverings that are as unique as they are. International brands, big showrooms, and large contracting firms all said making the process of ordering custom blinds online could never be simple or intuitive, but SelectBlinds.com is in the business of engineering solutions. We have over 500,000 5-star reviews proving the naysayers wrong!




Employment Type: Full-Time/Permanent

Juno Diagnostics is a young startup in the women's healthcare space. We are building a platform that enables women to have easy and affordable access to prenatal care.

Juno is reimagining the way medical information is communicated to the patient and we are building a platform to make this goal a reality. We have a team of world leading experts that can deliver the pregnancy relevant content. We are now looking for a highly creative and flexible front-end web developer with an expertise in React and React technologies, who can put this vision into code. You are a developer with a strong sense of visual design when coding and your solutions are responsive and work across tablet and mobile platforms.

We are moving quickly and are very focused on execution. In this position you will have frequent communication with the team, but also the option of working remote. If you are the right fit, we are happy to relocate you to sunny San Diego to come work with us. The team over here at Juno is very experienced and we are looking to bring people on that can be as passionate about our mission as we are.




You should bring:

7+ years of experience in web development, including client-side Javascript development
Expertise in React and React technologies such as Redux and React Router
Expert in various CSS systems including SCSS (Experience with Tailwind CSS a strong plus)
Familiar with token-based access control systems and understanding REST client development
Candidate should be familiar with Next.js and how to construct server-side rendered React pages




Other things that make you special (not required but great if you have it)

Server-side Node development
Experience integration React with A/B test tools and web analytics systems like Google Analytics
Experience with PWA technologies and use of mobile hardware resources like camera and local storage

At AKQA, we believe in the imaginative application of art and science to create beautiful ideas, products and services. With an entrepreneurial and collaborative approach, we design adaptive digital services and applications that capture the imagination, delivering impressive returns for our clients.




AKQA Front-End Developers have a strong dedication to recent and upcoming technologies, as well as the drive to develop innovative technical solutions.

You will participate in the creation of sophisticated digital experiences and must have advanced understanding of front-end web development. You will work with a team of highly skilled people – each with strong opinions about various technologies, frameworks and approaches to delivery.




ROLE REQUIREMENTS

You are an effective JavaScript programmer who doesn’t need to rely on libraries to accomplish innovative interactions
You are aware of the interplay between JavaScript and HTML and CSS, and you can dynamically create, modify, and style elements on a page with ease
You have an understanding of major browsers and the special considerations required for them
Strong knowledge responsive web design
Experience with translating comps and wireframes into flexible and usable code
Experience with version control software
Experience with Photoshop
Experience with developing large customer-facing websites
Must have at least 3+ years of experience working as a front-end developer
Must be available to work on-site in Sunnyvale, CA

QUALITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS

Eager to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Experience with web application development
Able to articulate their ideas to your team
Thrives when facing new challenges in improving client deliverables
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and able to interact professionally with a diverse group of people
Strong oral and written English communication skills
Boundlessly creative and relentlessly attentive to detail

Please note: No visa transfers or visa sponsorships will be offered at this time. Candidates for this role must be able to work West Coast hours and be willing to work onsite, in Sunnyvale, CA with the team, when we return to the office.

AKQA is an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe that diversity is vital to AKQA’s ability to provide our clients with the best recommendations and are committed to fostering a varied and inclusive work environment. Your race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or veteran status have no bearing on our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Who We Are

Ever wonder who brings the entertainment to your flights? Panasonic Avionics Corporation is #1 in the industry for delivering inflight products such as movies, games, WiFi, and now Bluetooth headphone connectivity!

How exciting would it be to be a part of the innovation that goes into creating technology that delights millions of people in an industry that’s here to stay! With our company’s history spanning over 40 years, you will have stability, career growth opportunities, and will work with the brightest minds in the industry. And we are committed to a diverse and inclusive culture that will help our organization thrive! We seek diversity in many areas such as background, culture, gender, ways of thinking, skills and more. If you want to learn more about us visit us at www.panasonic.aero . And for a full listing of open job opportunities go to www.panasonic.aero/join-us/ .

The Position

The Frontend IT Web Developer will be responsible for designing and delivering business critical web-based applications for enterprise clients using latest Front-End technologies such as but not limited to JavaScript, CSS, HTML, Node…etc. This role has responsibility for understanding client business and technical requirements and delivering appropriate end-to-end solutions. The developer will work with BSAs and other developers to ensure successful development of solutions that meet our customer's needs.

Works independently and simultaneously manage multiple assignments. Work in an efficient manner resulting in low defect, high quality software that fulfills the specified business requirements. Confer with management and personnel of other departments to implement projects.
Provides an ongoing maintenance and support for applications within the area of responsibility and provides production support.
Designs, develops and deliver technical solutions to business requirements.
Has experience to resolve moderately complex issues in creative and effective mechanisms.
Develops appropriate documentation for architectural, design, technical, implementation and test activities
Remains current with emerging Front-End Web technologies. Presents subjects/issues clearly to technical and non-technical audiences. Provides regular communication to management on programming assignment issues and status.
Communicates and reports issues, status, and results to management with recommended solution.
Adheres to standards ,controls and conducts quality assurance over programs before migration to production
Delivers assignments according to a schedule.
Analyzes applications and makes necessary changes to optimize performance.
Other duties as required to support and meet the needs of Panasonic Avionics Corporation.

What We Are Looking For

Expert knowledge of JavaScript, modern JavaScript libraries and tooling.
Expert knowledge of HTML, CSS, and related web technologies.
Expert knowledge of using CSS pre-proceeding techniques such Sass and Less.
Expert knowledge of using task runners and CSS compilers such as Webpack, Grunt.
Expert knowledge of consuming Web APIs.
Familiar with Visual Studio IDE.
Good knowledge of UX and HCI.
Working knowledge of WordPress development.
Working knowledge of at least one of JavaScript framework such as Angular or react.js.
Familiarity with Docker containers.
Good working knowledge of source control such as TFS, git.
Awareness of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance considerations.
Bachelors or master’s degree in computer science, or related experience.
HCI degree or UX is a plus.
8+ years solid working experience as a front-end developer.
Analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Experience working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Experience working with source code control, production control and issue tracking systems is plus.

Our Principles

Contribution to Society | Fairness & Honesty | Cooperation & Team Spirit | Untiring Effort for Improvement | Courtesy & Humility | Adaptability | Gratitude

What We Offer

At Panasonic Avionics Corporation we realize the most important aspects in leading our industry are the bright minds behind everything we do. We are proud to offer our employees a highly competitive, comprehensive and flexible benefits program.

We offer flexible remote work options depending on your role. Where possible, we offer fully remote or hybrid work opportunities.
Paid time off: Exempt Salaried employees receive unlimited PTO. This means that there is no fixed number, range, or limit to the amount of Personal and Vacation Days that may be taken for exempt employees. Non-exempt hourly employees accrue 14 vacation days per year + 7 sick days + 3 personal days. Accrual rate increases with tenure. All employees receive 11 company paid holidays per year plus a paid company-wide shut down in the U.S. between Christmas and New Year.
Health Insurance: Medical insurance offerings from Aetna and Kaiser (CA &HI). Options for Employee Only, Employee + Spouse/Domestic Partner, Employee + Children, or Family. Dental PPO and DMO options & Vision insurance through EyeMed or VSP.
401K with 50% match on up to 8% contribution, full vested from day 1
Other offerings include: Wellness Program, Counseling services, FSA & HSA, Life Insurance for employee, spouse and child, AD&D Insurance, Long-term and Short-term disability, Critical Illness Insurance, Accident Insurance, Legal Assistance, Pet Insurance, Identity Theft Protection, Dependent Care FLSA, Education Assistance, Commuter Program, Employee Purchase Program, Service Award Program.

All applicants are subject to Company policies, third party customer and worksite requirements, and government requirements, regarding vaccination and/or testing for COVID-19. Where permitted by applicable law, applicants may be required to be fully vaccinated with an authorized COVID-19 vaccine as a condition of employment, unless they are eligible for and obtain an exemption based on a reasonable accommodation because of a disability or a sincerely held religious belief, practice, or observance. While the Company strongly encourages COVID-19 vaccinations, it may require vaccination and/or testing for positions in which third party customer, worksite, or government requirements apply, in accordance with applicable law. At those locations where requirements apply, exemptions will be considered based on applicable law.

Panasonic is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law or company policy. All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Pre-employment drug testing is required for safety sensitive positions or as may otherwise be required by contract or law. Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest in Panasonic Avionics Corporation.

job_title: Software Engineer, Frontend – Vision Automation (San Diego)
description:
The Role

Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering team is currently seeking a frontend engineer that will own the web components of our computer vision platform for vehicle assembly and warehousing, our analytics and pattern recognition platform that governs Tesla’s purchasing decisions, or, depending on fit and opportunity, any one of a suite of apps this team is building that address the most difficult problems facing our growing Gigafactory network.

Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering team, in general, owns the centralized technical aspects of our multi-continent Gigafactory network and product line. The systems we work on include Tesla’s most important programs, such as Cybertruck, cell production, Robotaxi, and new factories globally. The software team is responsible for making these systems and operations every bit as intelligent and dynamic as the products themselves.

As a frontend software engineer on the Vehicle Engineering team, you will be in a product ownership role, leveraging whatever tech you feel fits best, e.g., React, graphQL, and/or websockets, to re-imagine what the global Gigafactory network should look like. Knowledge of both frontend frameworks and computer science fundamentals, like data structures and algorithms, are highly desired traits. The ideal candidates care foremost about the end-user experience, despite the issues that inevitably arise in complex industrial and scientific environments. The role will require the confidence to flex into design, backend, and network security, as needed, to make the final product successful.

Responsibilities

Deliver web applications that are useful to diverse groups, e.g. professional design engineers, program managers, production associates, and forklift drivers
Write reusable components with clean, modular patterns
Work closely with other software engineers to integrate with backend systems and solve networking problems
Work cross functionally with mechanical and design engineers to support evolving research projects and implement new features
Maintain and improve existing applications to better support the Vehicle Engineering team

Requirements

BS/MS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent industry experience
Working knowledge of the React framework
Proficiency with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Experience building streaming applications using, e.g., websockets
Expertise in debugging live software systems
Ability to demonstrate object-oriented, test-driven, and responsibility-driven design

Job Description

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Strategy and Integration, the Front-End Engineer is responsible for both supporting the development of new software applications and owning the creation, delivery & iterative improvement of UX (User Experience) deliverables. 




ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 

To perform this job, an individual must perform each essential function satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. 




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Develop software using Angular 8+ within team practices and guidelines
Create & deploy designs that enhance the user experience
Ensure applications are accessible across many platforms, including laptops and smartphones
Participate in interviews/discussions with users and stakeholders to understand user needs
Collaborate with entire Product Team to develop the overall look and design of the applications
Contribute to an inclusive, positive, improvement-oriented small-team dynamic
Operate as a self-starter who produces at a high-level consistently and without prompting

The Opportunity: You will work on concepts that will amaze you, work with a team that will inspire you, and help create products that truly add value to our users. Personal Capital’s WebUI team is agile and small, our data is rich and large, and this is your chance to be a member of this team and see your work make a significant impact not only on Personal Capital but also on the financial lives of our users.

The Candidate: You need to be a thinker and a doer. You need to be smart and build smart products. You need to be a perfectionist and really care for great user experience. You need to be a tester and always experiment with different concepts. You need to be ambitious: This is not an easy job. You will need to wear multiple hats, work with many unknowns, travel many unpaved roads to tackle large-scale problems. But it will be one of your finest work and creations, and an amazing engineering team is there to collaborate with you and support you.




The Work: As an engineer you will work on building modular, reusable front-end components.

Partner with leads to scope large cross functional projects, determine feasibility, and together, with the lead, manage the design and implementation.
Execute end-to-end software development in an agile environment including: requirements analysis, architecture, design, coding, testing, deployment, monitoring and support.
Come up with new ideas to improve our architecture and development process, get buy-in from the rest of the team, and put them into action.
Operate as a technical resource for other teams for best practices and provide advice, coaching, and education for other engineers.
Stay on top of technology and host tech talks for the team with proper points detailing how this could impact the technology organization.
Have a solutions mindset and bring about change by presenting proposals to solve problems, vs just highlighting problems.
Automate, Automate, Automate.




Qualifications:

Minimum of five years of software engineering experience, with at least threeyears on the front-end.
Demonstrable experience building world-class, consumer web application interfaces.
Ability to write high-performance, reusable code for UI components.
Strong knowledge of JavaScript fundamentals and ES6.
Strong command of web standards, HTML, CSS, cross-browser compatibility, and accessibility.
Knowledge of modern front end tools such as React.js, Webpack, Enzyme, and Jest.
Working experience with browser APIs, and passion for optimizing front end performance.
Knowledge of client-side visualization libraries such as D3 is a bonus.
Experience with A/B testing and optimization is a plus.
Do it all attitude!
Bachelor's degree or higher, in Computer Science or a related field.

Experience developing real-world web applications

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Interested in Machine Learning? As the SDE on the SageMaker UI team, you’ll get to work on:

The SageMaker Management Console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker )

This is one of AWS' largest consoles, and we're not slowing down! The baseline requirement is to keeps parity with SageMaker's rapidly expanding HTTP API's, but we'll push to also develop unique experiences for SageMaker metadata that are only possible in a browser or mobile device. You own our webservers and the bytes they vend, including the design, testing, continuous deployment, operations, usage analytics, and customer support.

Custom UI/widgets for authoring and data scientist IDE experience. From a browser, we're making a highly scalable and collaborative data science workbench so a data scientist, developer, or student can launch a wholly configured and sharable workspace in the cloud.

Key Responsibilities

Work closely with senior engineers, UX designers, and product managers to develop friendly UI experiences.
Work closely with engineers to architect and develop the best technical design.
Develop/maintain operational rigor for the frontend of a fast-growing AWS service.
Collaborate with other SageMaker SDE's for features that cut across SageMaker.
Engage with customers and other AWS partners.
Help with hiring.

You'll be well supported by a group with deep technical chops, including multiple senior and principal engineers.

What is SageMaker?

Amazon SageMaker (https://aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/) is a fully-managed Machine Learning platform that makes it easy to build ML models, manage them, and integrate them with custom applications for batch or online predictions. SageMaker takes away the “heavy-lifting” normally associated with large-scale Machine Learning implementations so that developers and scientists can focus on the truly creative work of modeling and solving the business problem at hand.

About Us

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.
Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education
Professional experience in software development.
Experience with web/mobile technologies (e.g., JavaScript/TypeScript, NodeJS, React, WebPack, HTTP mechanics/performance).

Preferred Qualifications

Experience building tools for data scientists or developers.
Attuned design sense so can collaborate with UX designers and hold a high bar with “backend” SDE's.
Experience with with CI/CD in a frontend context.
Experience establishing and leveraging web analytics.
Machine learning knowledge and experience.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.
Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.
Deep hands-on technical expertise in full-stack development.

At Scribd (pronounced “scribbed”), we believe reading is more important than ever. Join our cast of characters as we work to change the way the world reads by building the world’s largest and most fascinating digital library: giving subscribers access to a growing collection of ebooks, audiobooks, magazines, documents, Scribd Originals, and more. In addition to works from major publishers and top authors, our community includes over 1.5M subscribers in nearly every country worldwide.

We’re defining the workforce of the future with Scribd Flex, a program that embraces multiple perspectives while leaning into our belief that no matter where each team member is, we trust them to accomplish our shared business goals. This program lets employees, in partnership with their manager, choose where they work while creating intentional in-person meetings with co-workers that build culture and connect us personally.

Remote employees must have their primary residence in: Arizona, California, Colorado, Delaware, DC, Florida, Hawaii, Iowa, Massachusetts, Michigan, Missouri, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Oregon, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Washington, Ontario (Canada), and British Columbia (Canada).

This list may not be complete or accurate, and candidates should speak with their recruiter about their specific location for remote work.

About The Web Development Team

We’ve built a library of millions of books, audiobooks, magazine articles, sheet music collections, and user uploaded documents. 90% of millions of active users discover Scribd and continue to engage with content and build their libraries using our website. This team works across the stack with a strong focus on front end work.

We’re looking for diverse, well-rounded, communicative engineers to help empower our readers to indulge their curiosities and expand their knowledge by building quality products and user experiences. Our projects tend to be 1-2 front end engineers at a time, so faith, accountability, and excellent communication skills are extremely important.

Some Of Our Key Focus Areas

Responsive Web - desktop, tablet, phone – whatever device you have, we want you to be able to read!
Site speed - How fast is fast enough? Faster! Measure, optimize, repeat...
Accessibility - do you know what ARIA attributes are? Ever use a screen reader? We’re bringing Scribd up to WCAG level-AA to make reading work for folks who use assistive technology
Front end infrastructure - We strongly believe in code reuse and simplicity. We are working on shareable React component library and Design System to make our product development simple, fast and consistent.
SEO - with a library of millions of books, audiobooks and documents, search engine optimization is about a lot more than having a good sitemap.

About You

You're curious, humble, and interested in learning. You like and value people! You have good taste - you don't have to be a designer, but you should take pride in your work and want to make our app a beautiful, delightful reading experience

You Have

2+ years experience coding in a modern web stack -- eg. JavaScript, HTML, CSS -- on large scale, consumer-facing web applications
Good knowledge of modern JavaScript frameworks, preferably React.
Experience with continuous integration environments like Github, Jenkins, CircleCI , TeamCity etc.
Passionate about testing. Previous experience writing unit and integration tests with frameworks like Jest, Rspec, Enzyme, Cypress, Selenium, React Testing Library, etc.
Experience de-bugging issues in a complex modern web architecture which includes: distributed servers, CDN, image servers, databases, asynchronous web services, CSRF, cross site scripting, etc
Experience with Ruby on Rails or Python is a plus.

Benefits, Perks, And Wellbeing At Scribd

Healthcare Insurance Coverage: Scribd pays for employee’s Medical, Vision, and Dental premiums and a portion of dependent premiums
401k/RSP plans provided, plus company matching with no vesting period
Professional development: generous annual budget for our employees to attend conferences, classes, and other events
Quarterly Wellness, Connectivity & Comfort Benefit
Concern mental health digital platform
Free subscription to Scribd + gift memberships for friends & family
Leaves: 12 weeks paid parental leave, company paid short-term/long-term disability plans and milestone Sabbaticals
Generous Paid Time Off: Paid Holidays, Flexible Sick Time, Volunteer Day + office closure between Christmas Eve and New Years Day
Company-wide Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion programs which include learning & development opportunities, employee resource groups, and hiring best practices.

Want to learn more? Check out our office and meet some of the team at www.linkedin.com/company/scribd/life

Scribd is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences create a foundation for the best ideas. Come join us in building something meaningful.

Position Details

Location: Dearborn, MI

Reports to: Manager of D2C Digital UX

Department: D2C/Marketing

Status: Exempt

Job Band: Professional




Summary

The Web Optimization Developer will be responsible for establishing an ongoing optimization testing program and creating a structured process for AB/MV testing, creating success metrics for experiences, and reporting results to stakeholders and leadership. You will be the subject matter expert for session recreation tools and will harness personalization tools to assist in optimization. In this role you will work closely with the Carhartt Data team to identify issues, consumer friction points and understand the impact on key KPI’s. The ideal candidate for this role is experienced at analyzing and interpreting data, adept at working with cross functional teams, and can write accessible and reusable code to create experiences that streamline consumer journeys and remove barriers to task completion. You will also be responsible for identifying and resolving ADA compliance issues to meet WCAG standards.




We are All Leaders at Carhartt




In our words and by our actions, we strive to emulate the hardworking example set forth by our founder, Hamilton Carhartt. We Lead Business by creating value, delivering on results, and making changes along the way. We Lead Self by being dependable, because hardworking people count on us to have their back every day. We Lead Others by communicating and clearly defining the path as we walk bravely into the future. Working at Carhartt, we are all given a seat at the table and the honor of continuing the legacy.




Responsibilities

Continuously evaluate the website to identify friction points.

Partner with the Carhartt Data team to utilize and analyze user journeys to find issues adversely affecting KPIs.

Create and maintain a testing calendar for optimizations.

Communicate the objectives of testing, along with success metrics to leadership.

Coordinate and collaborate with SMEs and leaders in data, marketing, integrated media, creative, and merchandising to ensure the teams collectively deliver ONE premium customer experience across business initiatives and execution projects.

Act as end-user advocate and ensure balanced decisions are made.

Act as a project manager for optimization efforts. Manage project plan, health and progress reporting.

Write ADA compliant code utilizing HTML, CSS, and Javascript.

Identify and resolve accessibility issues on the site.

Provide project estimates with reasonable accuracy then independently execute against projects within speciﬁed deadlines.

Create dashboards and reports on optimization efforts, including performance to KPI targets.

Actively participate in team SCRUM’s and proactively identify risks and solutions.

Assist the team with coding day-to-day site changes as the need arises.

Education

Bachelor's degree or equivalent years of experience required

Required Skills And Experience

3+ years of professional experience developing digital ecommerce experiences.

1+ years of experience using web analytics and an A/B testing platform such as Adobe Test & Target, Optimizly, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or Quantum Metric.

Experience operating in or running a successful web optimization testing program.

Experience gathering testing requirements from cross functional partners.

Experience with a session recreation tool is a plus.

Familiarity with User Experience design best practices.

Knowledge of WCAG 2.1 accessibility standards and the ability to write compliant code.

A proven track-record of learning and playing with new technologies.

Passionate user advocate who can spot opportunities among the ‘noise’ of information and who can bring those opportunities to life on the site.

Ability to develop and drive execution of strategies, tactics, measurable implementation plans across channels.

Excellent organizational, analytical, communication and interpersonal skills, including a strong commitment to follow-up, follow-through, collaborate with cross-functional teams and a sense of urgency.

Ability to meet timelines and, when needed, work under deadlines while maintaining strong attention to detail and quality of your work.

Intellectual curiosity with an appetite for change.

Portfolio with representative professional, polished website development work and samples of website development projects.

Working Conditions

Remote or In-Office
Travel (5%)
Tobacco Free

21Shares/ Amun is a leading cryptocurrency issuer which aims to make purschasing crypto more accessible, and efficient.




Under its 21Shares brand, Amun is the world's largest issuer of crypto exchange-traded products (ETPS). The 21Shares suite of ETPs has simplified access to crypto for both institutional and retail investors in the traditional finance community. In a similar fashion Amun aims to provide tokens that will make it easy for the crypto community to access sophisticated strategies that are not otherwise readily available in this space. Amun 21Shares is a team of entrepreneurs, engineers, and financial product developers who are uniquely placed to revolutionize cryptocurrency investing through the issuance of our broad range of tokens. Our goal is to make these tokens present a new paradigm in cryptocurrency investing and facilitate their use.




Our investment in superior technology and automation has enabled us to both release products, aw well as work directly with top organizations including the Bitcoin Cash Foundation, Bitcoin Suisse, Binance, Bitwise, Coinbase, FlowTraders, Sygnum and the Tezos Foundation as launch partners or customers of Onyx, our full stack issuance platform.




Job Summary:

Genvid is pioneering Massively Interactive Live Events (MILEs) as a huge new category of transmedia. We provide the unique technology and services that enable this new form of cloud-based, live broadcast entertainment to be built on any of the top game engines and run on all major streaming platforms.

We believe viewers love live events, love communal experiences, and love when their participation matters. We believe the Metaverse is coming, and we’re already helping build its foundation.

We exist to power the next generation of these experiences — across gaming, sports and TV.

Our rapidly expanding workforce is composed of veterans from the video game and broader technology industries, with offices around the world. The Genvid team is extremely diverse, forward thinking, creative, and collaborative. We solve thorny problems quickly, reinvent the rules when necessary, and take pride in blazing new trails with major partners in the tech, social media, film and television, and pop culture sectors.

Our Solution:

Genvid Technologies is changing the face of the multi-billion-dollar livestreaming market through its proprietary technologies and related services, bringing real-time, interactive experiences to viewers of all kinds of broadcast content - even creating entirely new game-like experiences such as the recent Facebook Watch exclusive Rival Peak. With successive investment rounds in place, our well-funded company continues to grow quickly: we expect to triple in size over the next few years. Genvid’s clients include the biggest game publishers in the world, as well as video game engine creators, game consoles, streaming platforms, indie developers, Hollywood studios and other major IP holders.

Be part of the revolution of interactive broadcasting!

Web Developer

We are seeking a web developer with experience and interest in gaming. As part of the Genvid team, you’ll be involved in integrating games on desktop and mobile that work hand-in-hand with the Genvid stack. You should have an understanding of responsive web design, and experience with HTML5 games engines are a plus!

Reporting to the Partner Service Team Lead, in this role the Web Game Developer tasks and duties involve, but are not limited to:


Overseeing the support of clients’ software with our development tools, critical to the success of our business. Clients include the biggest game publishers in the world, as well as video game engine creators, game consoles, streaming platforms, and indie developers.
Contribute in designing, building, scaling, and supporting the integration of our technology and seeing to their deployment and support in the requested data center environments with the client and our partners.
The ability to translate clients’ design requirements into efficient and reusable code.
Creating minigames, achievement systems, and UI overlays that integrate seamlessly with client products.
Creating unit tests and working with QA to deliver quality code and ensure that bugs and problems are swiftly addressed on the client’s behalf.
Working with the Live Operations and Partnerships teams to understand the priority of client services and adjust your workflow accordingly.
Identifying improvements in systems management and the development process
Communicating the clients’ needs and development shortfalls by providing real time feedback to internal teams.
The ability to solve problems creatively, define best practices, and document findings to enhance team cohesion.
Provide on-going support and maintenance throughout the product's life cycle.


Experience & Education


Bachelor's Degree
5-7 years’+ experience in services and web application development
Experience with JavaScript, Node.js, Python, TypeScript, Go
Understanding of responsive CSS/web design
Ability to communicate clearly in English written and verbal
3+ years experience with React and other frameworks
AWS Stack (EC2, ELB, Route53 etc.) (knowledge of Azure, GCE
Be keenly aware of the strict security needs of our partners


Assets:


Startup experience
Strong problem solving skills
Advanced knowledge of network security principles
Experience in gaming industry or animation
HTML5 Canvas, HTML5 game engines (Three.js, PlayCanvas, etc.)
FB Instant Games experience a big plus
Experience with HashiCorp Stack (Consul, Nomad, Vault, Terraform, Packer)

About Zello

Zello builds technologies that connect and protect frontline workers, a staggering 80% of the global workforce. With over 150 million users, we turn any phone into a walkie talkie and provide a complete communications ecosystem for frontline organizations. We’re the industry leader, helping transportation/fleet management organizations, retail associates, paramedics, nurses, hospitality workers, and construction crews stay connected and get work done! As a company,




Zello is bootstrapped, has strong product-market fit, and is now accelerating its growth across a multi-billion dollar market.




We are seeking a conscientious, impact-focused ReactJS engineer to join our frontend development team. You'll work on cutting edge web and desktop web (Electron) applications, solving interesting problems in the realm of live audio communication. These products support thousands of customers and millions of consumers every day. You'll own projects from start to finish and contribute to technical decisions that help shape the direction of the platform. This position reports to the Director of Engineering.

Understand the design and construction of our client web applications sufficiently well to teach the key concepts to others

Continuously seek to improve product reliability, experience, and performance

Strong attention to detail and self-organizing, working in a collaborative environment

Flexible, not dogmatic - you keep the end in mind and understand there is always more than one way to solve a problem

Description:

As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for designing and implementing web application features, APIs, and backend processes. Your work will support a growing sales force of over 500 people and new online sales platform, contributing to sales efficiency, customer conversion and retention, and executive insight. You will be part of a fast moving, high performing, and visible team, and your work will drive how the teams perform.

Our main priority continues to be the health and safety of our employees. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, this position will be remote until further notice. We will continue monitoring the circumstances and when we feel comfortable, this position will return to the office in Kansas City where you will have an opportunity to collaborate face-to-face with a talented and diverse group of peers.

Responsibilities:

Design, code and develop complex web applications and analytics-driven solutions that will drive business growth
Participate in the entire lifecycle of web application deployment and maintenance (i.e. planning, development, deployment, maintenance, etc.), including ongoing continuous improvement and development of product
Partner with customers in developing web application solutions ensuring consistent, intuitive, and accurate results
Serve as a liaison to the customer throughout the entire life cycle of the product and independently resolve challenging issues
Work collaboratively in an inclusive and supportive team environment, while proudly owning results on projects, including performance standards and timeline


Required Qualifications:

At least 3 years of experience building rich web-based applications
Experience of building web applications using modern frameworks (React, Angular, Backbone, or similar)
Experience building web applications using Python frameworks, Django preferred
Strong understanding of SQL and experience with at least one DBMS


Preferred Qualifications:

Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
A good eye for visual design
Experience with Docker
Values a diverse and inclusive work environment

Standing out among the world’s largest logistics platforms, C.H. Robinson solves logistics problems for companies across the globe and across industries, from the simple to the most complex. Enthusiast Gaming (NASDAQ:EGLX)(TSX: EGLX)(FSE: 2AV) is building the world’s largest platform of communities for gamers and esports fans. A Bit About Us

Genius Sports is the official data, technology and commercial partner that powers the global ecosystem connecting sports, betting and media.

Our mission is to champion a more sustainable sports data ecosystem that benefits all parties - from the rights holder all the way through to the fan.

We are the trusted partner to over 500 sports organisations globally, capturing the highest quality data for many of the world’s largest leagues and federations such as the NFL, NBA, MLB, English Premier League, Serie A, FIBA and the NCAA.

From enabling leagues to take control of their official data, to creating immersive fan experiences for sports, betting and media organisations, we are driven to the deliver the difference for our partners.

What We Do

Sportstech

Data capture, management and analysis tools that help leagues run their sport, unlock new revenue streams, and protect the integrity of their competitions.

Video

Fully automated streaming technology, production and distribution services that help showcase sports to the world.

Sportsbook

Everything a sportsbook operator needs to manage their operation and grow profits – all powered by the finest live sports data available.

Media & Engagement

We help brands and publishers engage and monetise sports fans with personalised campaigns and content they will love.

We are looking for a Frontend Developers to help lead our Fan Engagement team in delivering Fantasy and Predictor products that engage sport fans around the world. We are after someone who is hungry to continuously learn and take ownership of the tools and products that they work on in accordance to best practices for Agile Software Development, Continuous Delivery and DevOps. Main Responsibilities

Development of new software products and components

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

The AWS Network Backbone Organization owns containerized solutions that protect the AWS network against impact every single day. The team is looking for Front End Engineers to join its organization and provide expertise to expand solutions that support the backbone of the entire AWS global network. In this role, you will interact with senior applied scientists, software, systems development, and network engineers to understand requirements and extend platforms that support software-defined networks (SDN). We are focused on enhancing customer experience through next generation technologies, and are seeking exceptional, entrepreneurial Web Frontend Engineers to help drive this mission.

Key job responsibilities

Translating product requirements for our web applications into well-designed, well-documented, and well-maintained front-end code.
Our tech stacks include mostly native AWS services, using AWS CDK, Next.js, and React.js single-page applications, including web views inside other native apps.
Your projects will receive direct feedback from internal team members who are not SDEs. This will allow you to learn a new domain and improve applications that are used every day.

A day in the life

Our Internal Stakeholders Include

Network Engineers who operated and design one of the largest networks on earth.
Software Engineers who build innovative technologies that are changing the Internet.
Senior and Principal Engineers and Applied Scientists who familiar with the codebase you will extend.

About The Team

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have a number of employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.


Basic Qualifications

3+ years of experience building production web applications.
Demonstrable evidence of building a technical solution across a team.

Preferred Qualifications

4+ years of professional experience with front-end technologies.
Backend, full-stack and AWS familiarity can help with troubleshooting.
Security (e.g., XSS, CSRF protection, defense in depth), TypeScript, Next.js, Node.js, Jest, Cypress.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


Company - Amazon Data Services, Inc.

Job ID: A1943377

About the Role




We’re looking for seasoned engineers skilled in shipping products and driven by customer demands. You will be instrumental in building the front-facing user experience of our products, and working alongside the team to ensure that our architecture uses the best principles, and development follows best-practices.




What you’ll be doing.




Drive ambitious technical projects that immediately impact our customers.
Some upcoming projects:
A system to handle flow-of-funds and asset tracking on exchange venues. This involves having a persistent job that is capable of sending transactions requests to venues based on user input (or algorithmically triggered items). This also involves ensuring that we have a local replica of the information provided on exchange venues (balances, order history, pricings, etc.)
An interface (API-driven, but GUI provided) to enable customers seamless access to both trading and settlement systems in cryptocurrencies. This involves building rapid prototypes, working with the design team, and making real-time product decisions to design how customers interact with FPG's products and services.
Aa system to normalize data across multiple venues, in-take this data, ensure its consistency, and ultimately store it into a data Warehouse. This involves working hand-in-hand with our research team to study cryptocurrency liquidity as well as macro trends within the market.




Work with the talented, ambitious, and creative members of our engineering team.
You'll be collaborating with our highly-motivated (and insatiably curious) engineers who bring with them rigorous and diverse industry experience, while also enjoying full access to our advisors, whose prolific careers at some of the world’s premier tech organizations have cemented them as invaluable resources to FPG.




Learn and grow at a breakneck pace as our company rapidly scales.
As an early team member, you will have an incredible degree of autonomy, it's something we intentionally build into our workflow. We expect that you not only take ownership of your work but that you have an appetite for doing so. As our product and team continue to grow, your responsibilities will inevitably follow suit - the organization is expected to double in size in the next three months.




Qualifications




You love shipping products.
You understand how to build systems that enable fast product iteration. You’re comfortable weighing trade-offs between functionality, quality, and technical debt.
You have at least 3 years experience of shipping professional products (post-docs, google work, contra etc.), bringing something from inception to actually delivering to customer hands.




You live and breathe for Front-End cloud Architectures
You learned Django; React; Node; Ruby on Rails, Angular, Asp.net, Vue, and Laravel when you were 5 and didn't stop there. You love building things for customers and when you hear web-app you immediately think you can build it in 4 hours.




You’ve designed and implemented complex distributed systems.
You have extensive experience with microservice architectures. You excel at assessing the strengths and limitations of various implementations. You have a keen intuition for seeing how a product requirement might necessitate a particular technology, an conversely, how a technology in our stack might constrain the functionality of our product.




You can recognize and advocate for technical excellence.
You strive to be a world-class engineer. You understand the discipline and craft of software development, you invest in learning and tooling, and you insist on technical excellence from yourself and your teammates.
You have a passion for designing and reverse-engineering product architectures.
Designing, building, and deploying distributed systems / micro-services with a focus on asynchronous applications, multithreading, distributed message queues, and data consistency.
Familiarity with API conventions / design patterns / anti-patterns / common pitfalls.
You are familiar with Cloud (AWS) infrastructure
Containerization + container orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS, etc.)
Experience with encryption & security standards (cloud-security)




You don’t take yourself too seriously!

description:
US Job Description

Firm Information

Reed Smith is a global relationship law firm with more than 1,700 lawyers in 27 offices throughout the United States, Europe, Asia and the Middle East.

Founded in 1877, the firm represents leading international businesses, from Fortune 100 corporations to mid-market and emerging enterprises. Excellent written and verbal communication skills

This policy applies to all U.S. partners and employees, regardless of full-time, part-time, temporary, exempt, non-exempt, or any other status or classification.

job_title: Frontend frameworks & Visualization Engineer , OpenSearch : Search, SQL & Observability
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

AWS recently announced it will be leading an open-source fork of Elasticsearch and Kibana, in order to ensure open source versions of both packages remain available and well supported.

We’re looking for individuals to join this effort. Much of the work is software engineering, and there is also a need for front-end development, technical writing, user experience design, community engagement, and many other roles.

Participation can take many forms. As a community-driven project, multiple companies and individuals will share responsibility for directing and contributing. AWS, as one of those contributors, is looking to hire a variety of full-time roles dedicated to developing, enhancing, and supporting these open source projects. These are unique opportunities to develop open-source software in a customer obsessed, highly collaborative team-oriented environment, while leveraging the resources of Amazon.com (AMZN), one of the world's leading internet companies.

Working in AWS Search Services

The Search Services team in AWS designs, develops and operates software that allows customers to index, search and analyze documents at scale in a secure, responsive, and reliable environment. The team is tackling tough data, search and analytics problems. As we expand at a tremendous rate, we are looking for innovative engineers with a passion for data, search, analytics and distributed systems to join the team.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This role is specifically for the OpenSearch Observability team focusing on building great software on OpenSource.org and operating it on AWS OpenSearch Service


Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related engineering discipline
6+ years of software development experience in Java, C/C++, and Python
4+ years of experience in distributed systems design and large-scale data processing

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s Degree or PhD in Computer Science
4+ years of experience with public cloud infrastructure
Experience with Elasticsearch, Apache Solr, or Apache Lucene
Have a focus on customer experience and satisfaction
